intro: Phalangium albucoides, commonly known as the white-tailed scorpion grass, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a mild, somewhat peppery scent. Phalangium albucoides is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
